privilege.name: Generally can make edits
privilege.discription: If a user has access to an itemthru some other privilege then they can make an edit to that item. The difference is that you may let a user see items but not let me edit the items.

taxonomy.name: Study Tab top block
taxonomy.content: Please note that you will want to fill all of these feilds out.

taxonomy.name: Study Tab bottom block
taxonomy.content: For more information on the study section of this model you can read here.

taxonomy.name: durability adherance convenience Tab top block
taxonomy.content: State the effort or difficulty to proceed with administration

taxonomy.name: durability adherance convenience Tab bottom block
durability adherance pill burden Tab top block
durability adherance pill burden Tab bottom block
durability adherance palatability Tab top block
durability adherance palatability Tab bottom block
durability adherance tolerability Tab top block
durability adherance tolerability Tab bottom block
LMIC Regimen Use Tab top block
LMIC Regimen Use Tab bottom block
Acute renal insufficiency
taxonomy.content: abrupt loss of kidney function resulting in the retention of urea and other nitrogenous waste products and the dysregulation of extracellular volume and electrolytes

taxonomy.name: Alopecia
taxonomy.content: hair loss or baldness

taxonomy.name: Anemia
taxonomy.content: condition in which the body does not have enough healthy red blood cells to provide oxygen to body tissues

taxonomy.name: Arthralgia
taxonomy.content: joint pain

taxonomy.name: Asthenia
taxonomy.content: abnormal physical weakness or lack of energy

taxonomy.name: Blood clotting
taxonomy.content: thickened mass in the blood formed by platelets

taxonomy.name: Cholangitis
taxonomy.content: infection of the common bile duct, the tube that carries bile from the liver to the gallbladder and intestines

taxonomy.name: Cholelithiasis
taxonomy.content: the presence or formation of gallstones in the gallbladder or bile ducts

taxonomy.name: Cholecystitis
taxonomy.content: inflammation of the gallbladder

taxonomy.name: Chronic Renal Insufficiency
taxonomy.content: progressive loss in renal function over a period of months or years

taxonomy.name: Diabetes mellitus
taxonomy.content: chronic disease in which there are high levels of sugar in the blood

taxonomy.name: Dyslipidemia
taxonomy.content: disorder of lipoprotein metabolism resulting in an abnormal amount of lipids (e.g. cholesterol and/or fat) in the blood

taxonomy.name: Erythema
taxonomy.content: skin redness

taxonomy.name: Flank pain
taxonomy.content: pain or discomfort in the upper abdomen or back

taxonomy.name: Gastrointestinal intolerance
taxonomy.content: upset stomach/irritation of stomach or intestine

taxonomy.name: Jaundice
taxonomy.content: yellow coloring of the skin, mucous membranes, or eyes caused by excess bilirubin in the blood

taxonomy.name: Hepatic flares
taxonomy.content: sudden increases in liver enzymes or viral load, while undergoing nucleoside/nucleotide analog therapy for chronic hepatitis B

taxonomy.name: Hepatomegaly
taxonomy.content: enlarged liver

taxonomy.name: Hyperbilirubinemia
taxonomy.content: excess production of bilirubin in the liver resulting in increased levels in the blood

taxonomy.name: Hypercholesterolemia
taxonomy.content: high levels of cholesterol in the blood

taxonomy.name: Hyperpigmentation
taxonomy.content: darkening of an area of skin or nails caused by increased melanin

taxonomy.name: Hypertension
taxonomy.content: high blood pressure

taxonomy.name: Hypertriglyceridemia
taxonomy.content: elevated triglyceride levels in the blood

taxonomy.name: Hyperuricemia
taxonomy.content: abnormally high uric acid in the blood

taxonomy.name: Hypophosphatemia
taxonomy.content: an electrolyte disturbance in which there is an abnormally low level of phosphate in the blood

taxonomy.name: Insomnia
taxonomy.content: trouble falling asleep or staying asleep throughout the night

taxonomy.name: Insulin resistance
taxonomy.content: failure of cells to respond to the normal actions of insulin

taxonomy.name: Lethargy
taxonomy.content: lack of energy or enthusiasm

taxonomy.name: Lipodystrophy
taxonomy.content: disorder of fatty tissue characterized by a selective loss of body fat or 'fat redistribution syndrome'

taxonomy.name: Lipohypertrophy
taxonomy.content: lump under the skin caused by accumulation of extra fat at the site of many subcutaneous injections of insulin

taxonomy.name: Malaise
taxonomy.content: generalized feeling of discomfort, illness, or lack of well-being

taxonomy.name: Male gynecomastia
taxonomy.content: enlargement of breast tissue in men

taxonomy.name: Metabolic syndrome
taxonomy.content: factors (e.g. high blood pressure, obesity, high cholesterol, and insulin resistancethat increase the risk for coronary artery disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes

taxonomy.name: Myalgia
taxonomy.content: muscle pain

taxonomy.name: Myopathy
taxonomy.content: muscular disease in which the muscle fibers do not function for any one of many reasons, resulting in muscular weakness

taxonomy.name: Neuro-/neurologic/neurological toxicity
taxonomy.content: chemical-driven damage to the nervous system

taxonomy.name: Osteopenia
taxonomy.content: bone mineral density (BMD) that is lower than normal

taxonomy.name: Pneumonia
taxonomy.content: lung inflammation caused by bacterial or viral infection

taxonomy.name: Prolonged PR interval
taxonomy.content: a disease of the heart's electrical conduction system that may indicate first degree heart blockage

taxonomy.name: Suicidal ideation
taxonomy.content: thoughts about suicide

taxonomy.name: Taste perversion
taxonomy.content: change in taste perception

taxonomy.name: Torsades de pointes
taxonomy.content: uncommon variant of ventricular tachycardia that can be the result of lengthening the QT interval and exhibits distinct characteristics on the electrocardiogram (ECG)

taxonomy.name: Birth defect
taxonomy.content: a physical or biochemical abnormality that is present at birth and that may be inherited or the result of environmental influence

taxonomy.name: Fanconi syndrome
taxonomy.content: a disease of the kidney's proximal renal tubules in which glucose, amino acids, uric acid, phosphate, and bicarbonate are passed into the urine instead of being reabsorbed

taxonomy.name: Hematuria
taxonomy.content: presence of red blood cells in the urine

taxonomy.name: Hepato-/hepatic toxicity
taxonomy.content: chemical-driven liver damage

taxonomy.name: Hypersensitivity syndrome
taxonomy.content: a severe unexpected reaction to medicine/s that is characterized by fever, rash, and internal organ involvement (e.g. hepatitis, myocarditis, nephritis, or pneumonitis)

taxonomy.name: Immune reconstitution inflammatory syndrome
taxonomy.content: condition in which the immune system begins to recover, but then responds to a previously acquired opportunistic infection with an overwhelming inflammatory response that paradoxically makes the symptoms of infection worse

taxonomy.name: Increased liver enzymes
taxonomy.content: condition in which inflamed or injured liver cells leak higher than normal amounts of liver enzymes into the bloodstream

taxonomy.name: Intracranial hemorrhage
taxonomy.content: hemorrhage, or bleeding, within the skull

taxonomy.name: Lactic acidosis
taxonomy.content: physiological condition characterized by low pH in body tissues and blood (acidosis) accompanied by the buildup of lactate

taxonomy.name: Lipoatrophy
taxonomy.content: localized loss of subcutaneous fatty tissues

taxonomy.name: Liver failure
taxonomy.content: inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic function

taxonomy.name: Myocardial infarction
taxonomy.content: heart attack

taxonomy.name: Nephrolithiasis
taxonomy.content: kidney stone

taxonomy.name: Nephrotoxicity
taxonomy.content: chemical-driven kidney damage

taxonomy.name: Neural tube defects
taxonomy.content: birth defects of the brain, spine, or spinal cord

taxonomy.name: Neuro-/neurologic/neurological toxicity
taxonomy.content: chemical-driven damage to the nervous system

taxonomy.name: Neuromuscular weakness
taxonomy.content: weakness of the involved muscles when nervous transmission is interrupted by nerve or muscle disease

taxonomy.name: Neutropenia
taxonomy.content: abnormally low presence of neutrophils in the blood, leading to increased susceptibility to infection

taxonomy.name: Pancreatitis
taxonomy.content: inflammation of the pancreas

taxonomy.name: Peripheral neuropathy
taxonomy.content: a result of nerve damage that often causes weakness, numbness, and pain, usually in the hands and feet

taxonomy.name: Prematurity
taxonomy.content: a broad term for neonates born at less than 37 weeks gestation

taxonomy.name: QT interval prolongation
taxonomy.content: a biomarker for ventricular tachyarrhythmias like torsades de pointes and a risk factor for sudden death

taxonomy.name: Rhabdomyolysis
taxonomy.content: breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of myoglobin into the bloodstream, which can be harmful to the kidney and often causes kidney damage

taxonomy.name: Seizure
taxonomy.content: the sudden disruption of the brain's normal electrical activity accompanied by altered consciousness and/or other neurological and behavioral manifestations

taxonomy.name: Steatosis
taxonomy.content: abnormal retention of lipids in the liver

taxonomy.name: Stevens-Johnsons Syndrome
taxonomy.content: life-threatening skin condition most commonly resulting from a drug reaction in which cell death causes the epidermis to separate from the dermis (another form of the disease is toxic epidermal necrolysis)

taxonomy.name: Stroke
taxonomy.content: the sudden death of brain cells in a localized area due to inadequate blood flow

taxonomy.name: Lab Code
taxonomy.content: Code used in the lab NOTE:This is a generated value based on the substance lab codes

taxonomy.name: Common Name / Abbreviation
taxonomy.content: Generic name used

taxonomy.name: Brand Name
taxonomy.content: Proprietary name of drug product

taxonomy.name: New Drug Code
taxonomy.content: Classification that reflects the type of drug being submitted to US FDA and its intended use

taxonomy.name: Approved For
taxonomy.content: Approved for use ina particular patient population

taxonomy.name: Manufacturer
taxonomy.content: Name of company that produces drug product

taxonomy.name: Commercial Company
taxonomy.content: Name of company that markets drug product

taxonomy.name: Innovator Company
taxonomy.content: Name of company that originally developed the drug product

taxonomy.name: Investigational
taxonomy.content: Drug is currently under investigation and not yet produced commercially or for sale on the market

taxonomy.name: Label Claim
taxonomy.content: Amount of active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) per unit of drug product, e.g., the number of milligrams per tablet.

taxonomy.name: Dosing
taxonomy.content: Number of products per administration

taxonomy.name: Dose Form
taxonomy.content: Physical form of a drug molecule by delivered to the sites of action within the body

taxonomy.name: Route Of Administration
taxonomy.content: Path by which drug molecule is taken into the body

taxonomy.name: Frequency
taxonomy.content: The number of occurrences of a dosing event per unit time.

taxonomy.name: Pill Burden
taxonomy.content: Number of pills per day

taxonomy.name: Inactive Ingredients
taxonomy.content: Other ingredients that are part of the dosage form of the drug product

taxonomy.name: Alternative Indications
taxonomy.content: Other indications than HIV that the drug product can treat (either for approved indications or off-label uses)

taxonomy.name: Special Considerations
taxonomy.content: Special considerations needed to take drug product (e.g. with food, time of day, etc.)

taxonomy.name: Storage Condition
taxonomy.content: For commerical drug products, storage conditions are listed on label. For investigational drug products, storage conditions as reported in literature, as part of regulatory filings, on Certificates of Analysis, etc.

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 1 Date
taxonomy.content: Date of succeeding

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 2 Date
taxonomy.content: Date of succeeding

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 3 Date
taxonomy.content: Date of succeeding

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 1
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product currently in clinical phase 1 study - which is when drug product is tested in a small group of healthy human volunteers to evaluate safety, determine safety dosing range and identify side effects? Some phase 1 programs may be in the intended patient population and not on healthy human volunteers.

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 2
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product currently in clinical phase 2 study - which is when drug product is tested in a small group of patients to evaluate dosing requirement and efficacy of drug product?

taxonomy.name: Clin-Phase 3
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product currently in clinical phase 3 study - which is when drug product is tested in a randomized controlled multicentered study to evaluate effectivness of drug product?

taxonomy.name: Lmic 1l
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product used for first line antiretroviral therapy?

taxonomy.name: Lmic 2l
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product used for second line antiretroviral therapy?

taxonomy.name: Lmic 3l
taxonomy.content: Is the drug product used for third line antiretroviral therapy?

taxonomy.name: SRA Approval Status
taxonomy.content: Stringent Regulatory Authority (SRA), e.g. WHO Prequalification Program, US FDA

taxonomy.name: SRA Approval Date
taxonomy.content: Date that SRA approves drug product

taxonomy.name: Biological Half Life
taxonomy.content: Plasma half-life of the API in humans

taxonomy.name: Metabolites Of Parent
taxonomy.content: Are any of the reported drug metabolites considered pharmacologically active?

taxonomy.name: Fasting Bioavailability
taxonomy.content: The percentage of administered dose of API in plasma for fasting patients

taxonomy.name: Fasting AUC
taxonomy.content: The total amount of API absorbed into bloodstream in fasted patient

taxonomy.name: Fasting Cmax
taxonomy.content: The highest concentration of drug molecule in bloodstream post-absorption in fasted patient

taxonomy.name: Fasting Tmax
taxonomy.content: The time after administration of drug when maximum plasma concentration is reached in fasted patients

taxonomy.name: Clinical trial name/Acronym
taxonomy.content: Name of clinical trial

taxonomy.name: Fed Bioavailability
taxonomy.content: The percentage of administered dose of API in plasma for fed patients

taxonomy.name: Fed AUC
taxonomy.content: The total amount of drug molecule absorbed into bloodstream in fed patient

taxonomy.name: Fed Cmax
taxonomy.content: The highest concentration of drug molecule in bloodstream post-absorption in fed patient

taxonomy.name: Fed Tmax
taxonomy.content: The time after administration of drug when maximum plasma concentration is reached in fed patients

taxonomy.name: Percentage of patients achieving viral load suppression
Cutoff used to define viral load suppression
Time to viral load suppression
taxonomy.content: The time it takes to achieve viral load suppression as defined in the study protocol.

taxonomy.name: Adverse events (AE)
taxonomy.content: Percentage of patients that discontinue the drug product due to adverse events (AE)

taxonomy.name: Virologic Failure
taxonomy.content: Percentage of patients that discontinue the drug product due to ineffectiveness

taxonomy.name: Lost to follow up
taxonomy.content: Percentage of patients lost to follow up

taxonomy.name: Other reasons
taxonomy.content: Percentage of patients that discontinue the drug product due to other reasons

taxonomy.name: MoA/Dmpk for Drug to Drug Interactions
Drug to drug interactions efficacy reduction
MoA/Dmpk for drug to drug interactions efficacy reduction
Time to failure
taxonomy.content: The amount of time it takes for HIV drug resistance to develop

taxonomy.name: Genetic mutation(s)
taxonomy.content: Change in HIV DNA that caused resistance to drug (eg. M184V)

taxonomy.name: Lab Code
taxonomy.content: Code that was given by the laboratory which discovered and/or developed the drug molecule

taxonomy.name: Chemical name
taxonomy.content: Name of drug product using IUPAC nomenclature, which includes naming of organic chemical compounds

taxonomy.name: Molecular formula
taxonomy.content: Expression which states the number and type of atoms present in a drug molecule

taxonomy.name: Mechanism of action
taxonomy.content: Specific biochemical interaction through which a drug molecule produces its pharmacological effect

taxonomy.name: Major Metabolites
taxonomy.content: Drug molecule that is administered not the active moiety but consequently converts to active agent which produces specific pharmacological effect

taxonomy.name: Structure of active agent
taxonomy.content: Molecular geometry, electronic structure, and crystal structure of drug molecule

taxonomy.name: Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) Registry Number
taxonomy.content: Number universally used to provide a unique, unmistakable identifier for chemical substances

taxonomy.name: Japanese Accepted Name (JAN)
taxonomy.content: Japanese for unique nonproprietary name assigned to drug molecule

taxonomy.name: British Approved Name (BAN)
taxonomy.content: Official nonproprietary name given to a drug molecule, as defined in British Pharmacopoeia

taxonomy.name: Pro-drug?
taxonomy.content: Drug molecule that is administered not the active moiety but consequently converts to active agent which produces specific pharmacological effect

taxonomy.name: Generic name (International Nonproprietary Name: INN)
taxonomy.content: International Nonproprietary Name (INN) - Official name designated by WHO for pharmaceutical substance or API
